content:
Also I want to call out something else to confirm:

I've been stating that we should try to move discussion off of the github issue and into a dedicated Zulip topic. Is this right? Is it realistic? =)

I think it has worked out pretty well for the compiler team. But I can imagine that a lot of folks don't have Zulip accounts. I can also imagine that it will make Zulip a bit more .. active? perhaps than it has been up till now. I'm not sure if this is entirely good or not.
If it makes Zulip more active, that sounds like a good thing.
And I do think we should push discussion to Zulip.

I like zulip discussions about issues, but it it sometimes hard to follow so many threads. I think we'd need a custom stream for that which we can just mute by default and only go into it if an issue links us there
I'm talking specifically about the lang-team MCP process here
and there would be a custom stream
but I'm not sure how much that helps :)
(in particular I wish Zulip had better support for muting a stream but unmuting a specific topic within the stream)
